title: All my fav resources!
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

fifa <- read_csv("data/week11_fifa_audience.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)

New names:
• `` -> `...1`

ggplot(fifa, aes(x = population_share, y = tv_audience_share, color = confederation)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 3) +
  geom_abline(slope = 1, intercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "red") +
  scale_x_log10(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 0.01)) +
  scale_y_log10(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 0.01)) +
  labs(
    title = "FIFA World Cup: Population Share vs. TV Audience Share (log10 scale)",
    x = "Share of World Population (log scale)",
    y = "Share of World Cup TV Audience (log scale)",
    color = "Confederation"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

Warning in scale_x_log10(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 0.01)):
log-10 transformation introduced infinite values.


Warning in scale_y_log10(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 0.01)):
log-10 transformation introduced infinite values.

title: About
text: This site is a project for my super cool Data Science Class.

title: Josh Goldhaber
text:
I am Josh Goldhaber, a sophomore at Pitzer College majoring in Data Science at Claremont McKenna College

title: Fifa Data

library(tidyverse)

  labs(
    title = "FIFA World Cup: Population Share vs. TV Audience Share (log10 scale)",
    x = "Share of World Population (log scale)",
    y = "Share of World Cup TV Audience (log scale)",

title: Fast Food
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

fastfood <- read_csv("data/fastfood_calories.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)

New names:
• `` -> `...1`

avg_cal <- fastfood %>%
  group_by(restaurant) %>%
  summarise(mean_calories = mean(calories, na.rm = TRUE),
            n_items = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(mean_calories))

avg_cal %>%
  slice_head(n = 10) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(restaurant, mean_calories),
             y = mean_calories)) +
  geom_col(fill = "tomato") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "Top 10 Fast Food Chains by Average Calories per Menu Item",
    x = "Restaurant",
    y = "Average Calories"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
